body:
> For debug_information_level, is the default for Release essentially 'none'?

Yes, that's correct.

> exceptions and rtti are not needed by tensorflow and at least rtti adds code size .
> (although maybe rtti is needed if we are not using proto lite runtime here).

I've turned off exceptions (though not rtti) for the protobuf and tensorflow library builds. I found I hit problems when trying it with the actual app though, but I'm guessing since it's only a small amount of code it wouldn't make a massive difference. Disabling exceptions on TF and protobuf did help a lot though.

Thanks for the comment though, I'd forgotten that RTTI was separate from exceptions, so I can try disabling that too!
body_html:
For debug_information_level, is the default for Release essentially 'none'?

Yes, that's correct.

exceptions and rtti are not needed by tensorflow and at least rtti adds code size .
(although maybe rtti is needed if we are not using proto lite runtime here).

I've turned off exceptions (though not rtti) for the protobuf and tensorflow library builds. I found I hit problems when trying it with the actual app though, but I'm guessing since it's only a small amount of code it wouldn't make a massive difference. Disabling exceptions on TF and protobuf did help a lot though.

Thanks for the comment though, I'd forgotten that RTTI was separate from exceptions, so I can try disabling that too!
body_text:
For debug_information_level, is the default for Release essentially 'none'?

Yes, that's correct.

exceptions and rtti are not needed by tensorflow and at least rtti adds code size .
(although maybe rtti is needed if we are not using proto lite runtime here).

I've turned off exceptions (though not rtti) for the protobuf and tensorflow library builds. I found I hit problems when trying it with the actual app though, but I'm guessing since it's only a small amount of code it wouldn't make a massive difference. Disabling exceptions on TF and protobuf did help a lot though.
Thanks for the comment though, I'd forgotten that RTTI was separate from exceptions, so I can try disabling that too!
